intro: Sphaerostephanos stresemannii, commonly known as the Stresemann's globular stephanos, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, also known as the carrot or parsley family, and is characterized by its unique, spherical inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense, globe-like cluster. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
